text: I spent half the day trying to get MongoDB to work on Cloud9. Finally got it to run. Phew! :sweat_smile:
I think we can use it instead of SQLite. It seems pretty straight forward so far..
That's amazing jasmine, I'm practicing ruby and other course these few days
Is it hard to implement on the server?

On Cloud9 it was a bit of a pain because when it generates the app for you it configures it for SQLite, so you have to undo that. I figured it out though. I haven't tried pushing it to Heroku but I think it should be fine. I'll try today.
